title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Karnataka to lead India's space tech growth
items.summary:
- *Karnataka* aims to capture 50% of India's space tech market and 5% of the global space economy by 2034 under the **Space Tech Policy 2025-2030**.
- The policy targets **USD 5 billion** investment, **500+ space startups/MSMEs**, **50,000+ high-skill jobs**, and the launch of **50+ satellites** from the state.
- It focuses on building **space manufacturing clusters**, testing facilities, and strong **ISRO/DRDO** linkages to boost upstream and downstream space capabilities.

items.title: Trial by fire: Over 60% of pharma SMEs may be forced to shut shop
India private sector slows to 10-month low as year ends
items.summary:
- HSBC's *India Composite PMI* fell to 58.9 in December, the softest since February, though still in expansion.
- The *Manufacturing PMI* eased to 55.7 and the *Services PMI* to 59.1, signaling easing momentum and a near-stagnant *job market*.
- *New export orders* rose to a three-month high as inflation stayed muted, and hiring slowed to its weakest since early 2024.

items.title: China November crude steel output hits a 23-month low
items.summary:
- In *November*, crude steel output fell by **3%** from October to **69.87 million tonnes**, the lowest for a month since December 2023, as margins narrowed and domestic demand waned. 
- The output slid **10.9% year-on-year** from November 2024, with about **35%** of steelmakers profitable by end-November, down from **45%** in late October. 
- Through the first 11 months of 2025, output reached **891.67 million tonnes** (down **4%** YoY), and China’s annual crude steel would likely fall to **950–960 million tonnes**.

items.title: Advanced manufacturing key to achieving Viksit Bharat vision by 2047: NITI Aayog
Japan manufacturing PMI contracts at slower pace in Dec
items.summary: - *Japan Manufacturing PMI* fell to **49.7** in December, still contracting but at a slower pace for the sixth straight month.\n- The *Japan services PMI* remained in expansion at 52.5, with the *composite PMI* at 51.5, suggesting some stabilisation in private activity.\n- Looking ahead to 2026, *business confidence* remains robust, but the manufacturing outlook is uncertain amid global conditions, aging demographics and rising costs.

items.title: Raebareli rail factory hits 15,000th coach
items.summary:
- MCF Raebareli manufactured its **15,000th coach** on December 15, a landmark for India's rail-coach production.
- In FY2025-26, the factory has produced **1,310 coaches** so far, with an annual capacity of 1,000.
- Located near Lalganj on the Kanpur-Raebareli Road, the ₹3,192 crore facility has built 7,000 **AC** and 8,000 **Non-AC** coaches.

items.title: Delhivery launches intra-city shipping in Mumbai, Hyderabad
items.summary:
- Delhivery announced an on-demand intra-city shipping service in *Mumbai* and *Hyderabad*, offering pickups within *15 minutes* of booking on its app.
- The service, previously rolled out in Delhi-NCR and Bengaluru, provides real-time tracking and lets customers choose two-wheelers for small parcels or larger vehicles for bigger consignments, with intercity reach to *18,850 pin codes*.
- *Nikhil Vij*, Head of Intracity Business, said Delhivery will continue to invest and expand to more cities to meet growing demand.

items.title: TVs may be costlier from January due to memory chips shortage, weak rupee
QuantumDiamonds to invest €152m in Munich site
items.summary:
- *QuantumDiamonds* plans to invest *€152 million* to build a new site in *Munich* to boost *European tech sovereignty* and semiconductor testing capabilities.
- Construction is set to begin in the *first quarter of next year*, with the facility expected to create about *200 high-salary jobs*.
- *SEMI Europe* urged the EU to incentivize investments to prevent the region from lagging behind the US and Asia in the tech field.

items.title: NTT chief: Japan needs niche chip revival
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- NTT chairman Jun Sawada says Japan should pursue *high-mix, low-volume* niche chips rather than chasing scale and price. 
- Japan backs Rapidus with a $65 billion plan, aiming for 2027 mass production and adopting NTT's *IOWN* technology. 
- The strategy aligns with the US to stabilize the chip supply chain and capitalize on investment opportunities while avoiding past low-cost, high-volume traps.

items.title: STMicro ships 5B Starlink chips; could double by 2027
items.author: Nathan Vifflin
items.summary:
- *STMicroelectronics* has delivered over 5 billion RF front-end modules for *Starlink* via *SpaceX* since 2015.
- A senior executive says volumes could double in two years as more satellite players adopt *BiCMOS*-based antenna chips.
- The space market is shifting toward commercial players, boosting demand for high-data-rate, space-hardened chips.

items.title: India unveils its first indigenous 64-bit dual-core microprocessor DHRUV64
MeitY plans trade code revamp for semiconductor
Tata Group discusses power, renewables and EV manufacturing expansion in Uttar Pradesh
Hydrogen demand in India set to double to 12 million tonnes by 2030: Report
Cheap copper imports hurting domestic manufacturing, says industry body
Maruti Suzuki to go for phased localisation of EV batteries ahead of e-Vitara launch
VinFast will increase investment in Indonesia to up to $1 billion
Texmaco Rail bags ₹132cr wagon order from Touax JV
items.summary:
- Texmaco Rail bagged a *₹132-crore* order from *Touax Texmaco Railcar Leasing Pvt Ltd (TTRL)*, its JV with *Touax Group*, to supply rakes. 
- The order for *BLSS* and *BVCM* wagons will be delivered in phases with full delivery by July 2026, ensuring quality, safety and performance standards. 
- The deal aligns with the *National Rail Plan* and *Vision 2030* to boost freight transport and promote sustainable logistics.

items.title: “India emerging as key contributor to global manufacturing,” ContiTech CEO Philip Nelles
AI & Robotics to boost India's manufacturing GDP by 2047
items.summary:
- *AI* and *robotics* are set to dramatically lift productivity and drive a potential **$1.1 trillion** boost to *India's* manufacturing GDP by **2047**.
- Without rapid adoption of frontier technologies, *India* could miss a **multitrillion-dollar** opportunity and fall behind global manufacturers.
- Policy support and bold investment in *AI*, *robotics*, and digitalisation could spark an *innovation-led* manufacturing renaissance.

items.title: Trade deficit narrows to 5-month low of ₹24.53 bn in November
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- The trade deficit narrowed to $24.53 billion in November, a **five-month low**, helped by sharp declines in imports of gold, crude oil and coal.
- **Exports to the US** rose nearly 10% MoM to $6.92 billion, with YoY US exports up over 21%, as talks on a **framework** to lower reciprocal tariffs advance.
- Overall exports rose to $38.13 billion in November while imports fell to $62.66 billion; **policy steps** such as *tax cuts*, an export package and reforms aim to cushion the economy.

items.title: India no longer needs to rely on China for speciality chemicals, says Shivtek MD
Wheels India signs technical assistance pact with Japan's Topy Industries for aluminium wheels
China snubs Nvidia’s H200 chips in favour of homegrown AI semiconductors despite US greenlight
SEPC-JARPL–AT win for Rampur Batura Mine
items.summary:
- *SEPC Ltd* tied up with *JARPL–AT Consortium* to execute the *Rampur Batura Opencast Coal Mine* project awarded by **SECL** in Madhya Pradesh, valuing about ₹3,299.51 crore over ~10 years.
- The scope includes materials, machinery, manpower, **project management** and consultancy to support the mining lifecycle.
- The arrangement adopts a **capital-efficient structure** to strengthen SEPC’s order book and long-term revenue visibility.

items.title: Inox Wind bags 102.3 MW order from ABREL subsidiary
items.summary: - *Inox Wind* has secured a 102.3 MW wind power order from *ABREL EPC Ltd*, a subsidiary of Aditya Birla Renewables. - The contract covers the supply of 3.3 MW wind turbines for projects in Karnataka developed by ABREL EPC. - CEO *Sanjeev Agarwal* says the deal strengthens relationships and supports India’s energy transition and decarbonisation goals.

items.title: Vidarbha, Marathwada to anchor Maharashtra’s next growth phase: CM Fadnavis
Southeast Asia turning into a major market, excited about opportunities in India: Cathay Cargo Director
CII calls for raising capex, focus on transport, logistics
items.summary:
- The *CII* urged a *12%* rise in central capex and a *10%* increase in state capex for *FY27*, prioritising *transport*, *logistics*, energy and the *green transition*. 
- It proposed a *Capital Expenditure Efficiency Framework*, a ₹150 lakh crore *National Infrastructure Pipeline 2.0* (2026–32) and a *cycle-based public debt framework* to boost *fiscal flexibility*. 
- To spur private investment, it recommends *tax credits*, compliance relief, *accelerated depreciation*, and an *NRI Investment Promotion Fund* with up to 49% government stake, plus easier *ECB norms* and faster *FDI clearances*.

items.title: India identifies 300 products to boost exports to Russia
items.summary:
- India has identified 300 high‑potential products—especially *engineering goods*, *pharma*, *agri* and *chemicals*—to boost exports to Russia as New Delhi targets a $100 billion bilateral trade by 2030.
- Current exports to Russia stand at about $1.7 billion, while Russia's imports from India total $37.4 billion, highlighting a sizable gap and a push to narrow the $59 billion trade deficit.
- The focus areas reflect India's strengths in *engineering goods*, pharmaceuticals, chemicals and agriculture, which align with unmet demand in the Russian market.

items.title: Fully committed to India's semiconductor ecosystem: Japan
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury
items.summary:
- *Japan is committed to bolstering India's **semiconductor ecosystem** with Japanese firms joining manufacturing initiatives and cooperating on ecosystem development and HR training.*
- *At an ORF event, the envoy highlighted close Japan–India collaboration, citing visits to Tata Electronics facilities and stressing the need for government support to advance semiconductor manufacturing.*
- *This cooperation sits within a broader aim to build resilient supply chains, boost **R&D**, and reduce reliance on single sources like *China*, signaling long-term significance for both countries.*

items.title: Cheap copper imports hit Indian manufacturing, says IPCPA
items.summary:
- *Zero‑duty copper imports* under FTAs are severely damaging Indian smelting and downstream manufacturing.
- IPCPA seeks a **3% safeguard duty** on copper imports and quantitative restrictions on inbound shipments.
- CEPA concerns: duties on copper wire rods fell to 1% in FY26 and may end by FY27, with a call to cap the TRQ at 29 KTPA.

items.title: Parliamentary panel recommends easing clearances for underground coal mining projects
Hydrogen demand in India set to double to 12 million tonnes by 2030: Report
President Draupadi Murmu stresses energy conservation to cut emissions and ensure sustainable future
India to push solar energy, agriculture and mining ties with Ethiopia during PM Modi’s visit: ambassador Anil Kumar Rai
New labour codes aimed at easing supply chains and widening wage coverage: Labour Ministry advisor
The GenAI revolution: How enterprise leaders can manage AI adoption in the workplace
SpaceX share sale values IPO at $800B
items.author: Joey Roulette, Gursimran Mehar
items.summary:
- **SpaceX** is preparing for a possible 2026 IPO and has opened a secondary share sale that could value the company at **$800 billion**, with up to **$2.56 billion** of shares sold to investors.
- The funds would back expansion of *Starlink* and the *Starship* program, including plans for AI data centers in space, Moonbase Alpha, and Mars missions.
- Reuters, Bloomberg and others have floated a potential IPO as early as June 2026, but timing and valuation remain uncertain, with some reports suggesting a >$1 trillion figure.

items.title: SKF showcases intelligent, clean technologies for construction and mining at EXCON 2025
Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan bats for gradual semicon growth for India
AI won't steal jobs: Chandok's last-gen stability claim
items.summary: - *Chandok* says AI will not “steal” jobs but will *unbundle* them, making this generation the last with stable, long-term careers.\n- He warns the real pink slip is a refusal to *learn* and urges continuous skill updates as AI adoption grows.\n- Nadella adds that *data* is a strategic asset and Microsoft’s AI tools are used for cyber safety, signaling a shift to new skills and a portfolio of work.

items.title: Fully committed to India's semiconductor ecosystem: Japan
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury
items.summary:
- *Japan* commits to bolstering India's *semiconductor ecosystem*, offering cooperation in ecosystem development and *HR training*. 
- Keiichi highlighted collaboration with about 160 Japanese companies and visits to Tata Electronics facilities to push manufacturing in India. 
- The 2023 strategic partnership aims at resilient supply chains, boosting *R&D* and talent to reduce reliance on single sources like *China*.

items.title: Nestle India appoints former Pernod Ricard HR head Nitu Bhushan as its new HR chief
Nvidia considers increasing H200 chip output due to robust China demand
How tight supply, AI demand propelled copper towards $12,000
items.summary:
- Copper is nearing $12,000 per ton as **tight supply** and *AI-driven demand* converge.
- Widespread investment in *power grids*, data centers, and the energy transition is fuelling sustained copper demand.
- Analysts expect a demand-supply deficit and price support from macro flows and copper ETFs.

items.title: PTC India, NLC India form JV for 2,000 MW green energy
items.summary:
- *PTC India* and *NLC India Renewables Ltd* form a *joint venture* to explore up to **2,000 MW** of green energy projects, starting with around **500 MW** in the first phase.
- The JV will target project development, power trading, renewable energy park creation, and integration of solar, wind, hydro, battery energy storage systems, and green ammonia.
- Ownership is **74%** by *NLC India Renewables Ltd* and **26%** by *PTC India*, with board appointments and rights to sell power via regulated and competitive routes.

items.title: McCain Foods to invest ₹3,800 crore in MP plant
items.summary:
- McCain Foods to invest ₹3,800 crore in MP to establish a frozen *potato* products unit as an anchor in Agar Malwa's **Phase 3**.
- Land allotment covers around *70 acres* in Agar Malwa's **Phase 3**, with **₹1,800 crore** in the first phase.
- It aims to benefit *potato farmers* across *Malwa* by providing a stable market and boosting value addition, while creating jobs.
